intro: Lysimachia grammica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed yellow mosquito plant, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. Lysimachia grammica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
